title: ‘We had some wild parties’: Jason Donovan lists Bondi Beach unit
text:
It was the early 1990s and Neighbours star Jason Donovan was staying at the Bondi Beach apartment of his best mate, film producer Jonathan Shteinman, that overlooked the ocean.

“He always stayed with me and as much as I enjoyed his company, I preferred to have the place to myself so I said, hey, next door is for sale, why don’t you buy that!” Shteinman said.

So began the many summers of “wild parties” at the three-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment at 7/68-70 Campbell Parade, Bondi Beach, that’s only now hitting the market with Raine and Horne Double Bay/Bondi Beach’s Hannan Bouskila.

It’s going to auction on November 7, so fresh that they are yet to reveal a price guide.

But Shteinman spoke exclusively to the Wentworth Courier, revealing Donovan was selling up to help fund the purchase of a property on the holiday island of Mallorca in Spain.

Exclusive look inside $60m Point Piper mansion

The listing follows the sale — for an undisclosed price within its $8.2 million-$9 million range — of his Toorak mansion last month. Donovan, 51, his wife Angela Malloch and two of their children, Jemma and Zac, had lived in that five-bedroom English Tudor-style home from 2001 to 2009. Their third child, Molly, was born in 2011.

The family now lives in a mansion in Kensington in London worth about $10 million and only weeks ago he showed he was a good neighbour by helping to extinguish a fire raging at a home across the road in just his underwear.

Donovan recently played Pharaoh in a revival of Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat in the West End.

And British PM Boris Johnston referenced him 10 days ago in his keynote speech at the Tory conference saying: “We export Jason Donovan CDs to North Korea, would you believe it!”

The Bondi Beach apartment was purchased at a very different time in the Aussie star’s life.

Shteinman remembers: “We joined both the apartments and had some pretty wild parties during the mid-90s.

“He was going out with Erica Baxter for a number of years, who became Mrs Packer, we had Kylie Minogue stay occasionally.

’It was around the time he went over to Kate Moss’s 21st at the Viper Room in Los Angeles and had his unfortunate collapse.”

Donovan documented the party, also attended by Michael Hutchence and Johnny Depp, in his autobiography between The Lines: My Story Uncut. He woke up in a hospital with a doctor advising: “I suggest you lay off the drugs from now on.”

It was Shteinman, best known for his work the award-winning film Angel Baby (1995), Rabbit-Proof Fence (2002) and Romper Stomper (1992), who’d done the bidding for Donovan at the “competitive” auction way back then in 1994.

It had cost $451,000, which seemed like big bucks at the time.

Although Donovan had already owned homes in Melbourne, it was his first and only Sydney property.

“He loved Bondi and he’s sad to see it go,” Shteinman says, who’d met Donovan a few years before that through film industry connections.

“It’s in such a fantastic spot with such a great view … it evokes that wonderful feeling of having a great time.

“Jason worked very hard when he was younger, from when he was at school in Neighbours, straight into a hectic music career in the UK and the lead in Joseph [and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat], but he got to enjoy himself in Bondi.”

Mr Bouskila says Donovan had been collecting $1700 per week in rent prior to the tenants moving on. But the new owner could expect up to $2000.

He says the apartment, which is one of just eight in The Empire complex, will be popular because of its never-to-be-built out views of Bondi Beach and the ocean to Ben Buckler.

It has a sunny northeast aspect from its huge windows, Scandi-style Oak floorboards and freshly painted interiors.

Two of the bedrooms have beach views. There’s a modern kitchen with integrated appliances.
description: Just a month after his Toorak mansion sold for more than $8 million, Jason Donovan has put his Bondi Beach apartment up for November 7 auction.
